page.title: 12Perth Highland Games.
page.content: The{South Inch}was the setting, and from early morning{bagpipes}could be heard over{Perth}as solitary pipers and kilted bandsmen practised for the {competitions}later in the day. { Tourists}from all over the{world}were thrilled to see{tartan kilts}swinging as massed{pipe bands}marched by, and cameras clicked continuously as lithe {Highland dancers,}from as far away as {Canada and Australia,}competed against their Scots counterparts. There were pipe bands from{thirty two countries including Denmark, Holland and far off Queensland.The last won their section. Visitors' eyes widened as they saw {cabers}tossed,{hammers}thrown, 56lb. {weights}clearing{high bars.}It was all there.{Huge crowds}had a great day. An added bonus was that in one of the {wettest summers}on record, on Sunday 11th August 1985, it stayed{dry.
